questions.question_text:
Users at Universal Containers want to know how Approval requests will be routed prior to submitting a Quote for approval.
How can the admin meet this requirement?

choices.A: Using Native Approvals, build a custom Visualforce Page to display the Approval Process for the Quote.
choices.B: Using Native Approvals, build a custom button to display the approval matrix to users.
choices.C: Using Advanced Approvals, place the Preview Approval button on the Quote page layout.
choices.D: Using Advanced Approvals, build a custom Visualforce Page to display the approval Chains for the Quote.

Create two Price Books: one General Access Price Book with the 80 generally available Products, and one Special Access Price Book with all 100 Products. Use Guided Selling to assign the appropriate Price Book based on the level of User access.
choices.B: Create two Price Books: one General Access Price Book with the 80 generally available Products, and one Special Access Price Book with the 20 Special Access Products. Create automation to populate the appropriate Price Book ID into the SBQQ__QuotePricebookId_c on the Opportunity.
choices.A: Create one Price Book that contains all 100 Products. Create a custom Product field to designate General Access and/or Special Access. Utilize Hidden Search Filters to support dynamic Product visibility based on the level of User access.
choices.C: Create one Price Book that contains all 100 Products. Create a Validation Rule on the Quote object to prevent selection of a Special Access Product based on the level of User access.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers sells a total of 100 Products. There are 80 Products that are generally available for selection by all users (General Access). The remaining 20 Products should only be available to a certain group of users (Special Access).
Which Product Selection and Price Book strategy should the admin utilize to meet the requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think it's A. That way if a special access user works on a quote that a general access user created, they can add the special products to the quote.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_search_filters.htm&type=5

Choose C. Pros:

Simplicity: This option is straightforward and leverages Salesforce's built-in functionality.
Dynamic Updates: Automatically routes requests to the correct manager without needing manual updates if management changes.
Less Maintenance: Minimal administrative overhead since it doesn’t require custom fields or additional logic.
Cons:

May not support complex routing scenarios or specific exceptions without additional configurations. Option A requires more config. The setup is fully explained here; https://salesforce.stackexchange.com/questions/28156/approval-process-next-automated-approver-determined-by#:~:text=Selecting%20Next%20Automated%20Approver%20Determined,field)%20of%20the%20current%20user.

Selected Answer: A
"Next Automated Approver Determined By" is used in NATIVE APPROVAL PROCESS

This question is talking about Advanced Approvals and Approval Rules and therefore, A is the correct answer.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_aa_dynamic_approvers.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: A
I think it's A because it's mentioned that Advanced Approvals and Approval Rules are used:
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_aa_dynamic_approvers.htm&type=5

The Next Automated Approver Determined By is used in native approval processes.

Selected Answer: A
Further confirmation it's A - https://milomassimo.com/Salesforce-CPQ-Advanced-Approvers.html To quote - "We can also assign approvers dynamically based on certain criteria by populating the "Approver Field" on the Approval Rule record with the API name of a field on the object you submit for approval. This field needs to be populated with the ID of the approver's user record. "

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) uses the Advanced Approvals package for Its Approvals process on Quotes. UC's business model requires that Approval requests are assigned to the user's direct manager.
How can the admin ensure that these Approval Rules assign generated Approvals to the user's manager?

choices.B: Populate the Approver lookup on the Approval Rule with the Approver corresponding to the user's manager.
choices.A: Define the approver Field on the Approval Rule as a custom Quote field which contains the user's manager's User 1D.
choices.D: Let the user choose the Approver manually and create a Validation Rule to prevent the user from choosing different Approver than the manager.
choices.C: Set Next Automated Approver Determined By to Manager on the Approval Process.

questions.question_text:
An admin wants to set up a product bundle that dynamically generates SKUs depending on what users choose during the selling process.
Which three fields are required for this type of configuration? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SBQQ__Discount__c
"A percentage discount that applies to your configured SKU only when it’s part of a bundle."

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_product_option_fields.htm&type=5
C is the right answer. If you use the "Discount" field in product option then the price will be reflected in Special Price, not List Price.
Definitely C. Just tried both option C and D, D doesn't work. Answer is C

The right answer here is C. Since the desire is to have a list price of 800, then Option Unit price must be used. Option Discount will only be reflected in Special Price

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) sells its Support SKU both as a stand-alone Product and a Product Option within a bundle. When sold as a stand-alone Product, the expected List Unit Price is $1,000. When sold as part of a bundle, UC wants to reduce the List Unit Price to $800.
What should the admin do to meet the requirement?

choices.A: Create a Product Rule to insert 800 into the SBQQ_ListPrice_c field on the Quote Line when the SBQQ_RequiredBy__c field is blank.
choices.D: Enter 20 into the SBQQ__Discount_c field on the Product Option to reduce the price from $1,000 to $800.
choices.B: Create a workflow rule to insert 800 into the SBQQ_ListPrice_c field on the Quote Line when the SBQQ_RequiredBy__c field is blank.
choices.C: Enter 800 into the S8QQ_UnitPrice__c field on the Product Option to define a bundle-specific price for Support.
